main.description: Official SORMAS website - Surveillance, Outbreak Response Management and Analysis System

ProductOverview.Summary: SORMAS (Surveillance, Outbreak Response Management and Analysis System) is an open-source mobile and web application for disease surveillance and outbreak response.
ProductOverview.Description: SORMAS provides comprehensive tools for case detection, contact tracing, outbreak investigation, and response management. It supports real-time data collection, analysis, and reporting to enable rapid response to public health threats and disease outbreaks.
ProductOverview.PrimaryFunctionality: Comprehensive disease surveillance and outbreak response management system
ProductOverview.Users: Public health officials, epidemiologists, disease surveillance teams, outbreak response coordinators, and field workers

Reach.SummaryOfReach: SORMAS has been implemented in multiple countries to support national disease surveillance and outbreak response activities.

Maturity.SummaryOfMaturity: All maturity model assessments are self-reported by the funded organization leading the development of the global good.

Community.DescriptionOfCommunity: SORMAS is developed and maintained by the Helmholtz Centre for Infection Research with support from the global public health community.

HostAnchorOrganization.name: Helmholtz Centre for Infection Research
HostAnchorOrganization.description: Research center for infection research and public health

Sustainability.Description: SORMAS is supported through open source development and community contributions.
